common_issues.title: Pieces OS stuck, extensions not working
common_issues.description: Users report Pieces OS getting stuck, failing to launch, or extensions (especially Visual Studio) not connecting. This seems linked to OS errors during applet hosting. Workarounds include restarting Pieces OS or updating to the latest version. Root cause still under investigation.

related_issues.title: Pieces OS apparently stuck - VS extension not working
related_issues.text:
Pieces OS apparently stuck - VS extension not working
### Software

Pieces OS, Visual Studio

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.1.14.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Hi, I have just installed Pieces on my Windows 11 laptop and I'm experiencing some problems, specifically with Pieces OS and the Visual Studio extension.
Somehow, the desktop app works fine.

Pieces OS seems stuck in the system tray. Every time I click it, a "Sentry Error Event" appears in the log file and the application doesn't do anything.
At the same time, the Visual Studio extension shows a window saying that Pieces OS is not running. If I click on the launch button, a "route not found" message appears for a moment and then the "Pieces OS is not running" message comes back.

I checked for updates on the Pieces Suite app, but there are no update.

I'm attaching the log file and the response of the http://localhost:1000/applications url. I tried navigating manually to the url opened by the launch button in Visual Studio [(url)](http://localhost:1000/?application=%7B%22name%22%3A%22VISUAL_STUDIO%22%2C%22platform%22%3A%22WINDOWS%22%2C%22privacy%22%3A%22OPEN%22%2C%22capabilities%22%3A%22BLENDED%22%2C%22mechanism%22%3A%22MANUAL%22%2C%22schema%22%3A%7B%22semantic%22%3A%22MAJOR_0_MINOR_0_PATCH_1%22%2C%22migration%22%3A0%7D%2C%22id%22%3A%229ab3c1de-0625-408e-8d42-8e2c48e11d0c%22%2C%22version%22%3A%223.0.0%22%2C%22onboarded%22%3Afalse%2C%22automaticUnload%22%3Afalse%7D&capabilities=1048575&theme=%7B%22darkMode%22%3Atrue%2C%22scaffoldBackgroundColor%22%3A-14737633%2C%22primary%22%3A-328966%2C%22secondary%22%3A-14737633%2C%22onPrimary%22%3A-10724260%2C%22onSecondary%22%3A-328966%2C%22primaryContainer%22%3A-13421773%2C%22surface%22%3A-13750738%2C%22onSurface%22%3A-328966%2C%22error%22%3A-934979%2C%22onError%22%3A-1%7D) and the response is "Route not found".

Thank you in advance.

[log-11252024.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/17903747/log-11252024.txt)
[applications.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/17903752/applications.txt)

## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Key Points Raised:**

* OS toolbar not launching when trying to launch the Visual Studio plugin.
* Toolbar not launching in any way (from VS, desktop app, etc.).
* Pieces OS restarting on its own.
* Applet issues persisting.

**Problems Identified:**

* Visual Studio plugin version 3.0.0 issue with new webview based Tool Window.
* Dart language sdk not returning the actual OS error code.
* OS error trying to host applets.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Visual Studio plugin hotfix version 3.0.1 released to resolve UI thread hang.
* Pieces OS version 10.1.15 released with changes to webview port selection.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The above solutions may not have fully resolved the issue.
* Further debugging is needed to identify the root cause of the OS error.
* A time is being scheduled with the user to gather more information and potentially run a utility to retrieve the OS error code.

**Additional Notes:**

* The user is experiencing issues with both the VS plugin and Pieces OS itself.
* The problem seems to be related to an OS error, but the specific cause is still unknown.

## Closing Thoughts

While some solutions have been implemented, the user is still experiencing issues. Further investigation is needed to identify the root cause and implement a permanent fix.

common_issues.title: Onboarding Failures and Demo Chat Issues
common_issues.description: Users reported onboarding issues with Pieces failing to generate snippets and demo chats, particularly after resetting the application. This was often linked to permission errors with cloud services.  The recommended solution involved deleting both 'com.pieces.os' and 'com.pieces.pfd' folders before restarting. Additionally, some users experienced persistent loading issues with demo chats, even after successful piece loading.

related_issues.title: Onboarding doesn't generate pieces nor demo chats
related_issues.text:
Onboarding doesn't generate pieces nor demo chats
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

15.1.15

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When I reset pieces (deleting the com.pieces.os and com.pieces.pfd folder) and restart the onboarding with the following parameters:
```
 language: Go,  
 persona: Engineering Leader,  
 experience: 3-5,  
 developer Types: DB Eng, System Admin, Network Eng, DevOps, ML Eng, Back-End
```

The onboarding didn't generate any pieces nor demo chats:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/43e7a826-7635-47cd-b2fe-f2cc7ed4a676)
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ffb71d2f-6f6d-41c4-84a1-3d85773c3525)

The demo prompts doesn't reflect my choices either:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/5d52c78b-f151-4aca-88e6-f4fc0b7fa128)

Logs:
pOS: [log-12072024.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/18047726/log-12072024.txt)
PfD: [log-12072024.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/18047725/log-12072024.txt)

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points:**

* User @hra42 reported an issue where onboarding snippets and conversations were not generated after deleting local database and completing onboarding.
* @mark-at-pieces identified a bug related to existing users not generating onboarding content when the `com.pieces.pfd` folder was not deleted.
* @mack-at-pieces confirmed the issue and attributed it to a `PERMISSION_DENIED` error with Pieces' cloud services.

**Solutions:**

* Delete both the `com.pieces.os` and `com.pieces.pfd` folders before restarting Pieces Operating System (pOS) and Pieces for Desktop (PfD).

**Current Status:**

* The issue appears to be resolved with the suggested solution. 
* The conversation ends without further updates. 

**Additional Notes:**

* The provided error message indicates a permission issue with accessing the cloud services, which likely prevented the generation of onboarding content.
* While the specific cause of the permission error remains unclear, the solution suggests a potential issue with data persistence or configuration when only the `com.pieces.os` folder is deleted.

common_issues.title: Local LLM download and integration issues
common_issues.description: Users experience difficulties downloading large LLM models due to unstable network connections. Manual downloads are not recognized by Pieces, and restarting the process truncates existing files. Workarounds include ensuring stable connections or using smaller models.

related_issues.title: Manually downloading a LLM
related_issues.text:
Manually downloading a LLM
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

Latest

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I am attempting to install Pieces with a local LLM. Unfortunately, I have an unstable network connection (which is why I want a local model in the first place.) I am trying to get Mistral-7B.

I found that Pieces wants to download the whole model (4 GB) all at once. If it fails for whatever reason, it restarts from the beginning.  This is annoying and it makes downloading virtually impossible, because my network connection does not stay long enough to pull 4GB in one go.

I have figured out where the file is being downloaded to and from, and managed to download it manually with wget. Now the problem is that Pieces refuses to recognize it. Even if I put it in the right place, the Pieces app stil shows the Download button in the UI, and clicking Download truncates the file to zero and starts the download from the beginning.

I tried to edit models.db and change "downloaded" to true in the relevant line, but it has no effect.

Is there anything else I could do?
No comments found on this issue.

common_issues.title: Pieces Desktop Scrolling and Loading Issues
common_issues.description: Users report difficulties with scrolling in Pieces Desktop, particularly when answers are streaming in. Some experience stuck loading screens, especially with demo chats. Proposed solutions include improving scroll behavior to allow upward scrolling during streaming and ensuring automatic scrolling down unless manually overridden. Additionally, investigating and resolving loading issues, potentially related to VM setups, is crucial.

related_issues.title: Pieces Desktop does not scroll when answering
related_issues.text:
Pieces Desktop does not scroll when answering
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

2.12.2

### Early Access Program

- [X] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When answering, the curser stays with the question, should move to the answer. Requires clicking the arrow-down symbol to the end and then fine-navigating to the begin of the answer.
## Conversation Summary

**Problem:**

* Users are unable to scroll up when new messages are being streamed in, which prevents them from consuming the first part of the content.
* The current scroll behavior keeps scrolling to the end of the answer, even if the user wants to stay at their current position.
* Users expect the view to scroll down automatically unless manually scrolled up.

**Solutions:**

* Implement a way for users to scroll up while new messages are being streamed.
* Allow users to keep their scroll position while new messages are being added.
* Implement automatic scrolling down unless the user scrolls up.

**Current Status:**

* Several improvements have been pushed out in this area.
* Users are requested to test the latest version and report any remaining issues.

**Key Points:**

* The scroll behavior is a significant usability concern for users.
* Users have different expectations and preferences regarding scroll behavior.
* Multiple solutions are being explored to address the problem.
* The issue is ongoing and requires further testing and development.
